title: firefox crashing in Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS
content:
Subject: Assistance Required for Frequent Firefox Crashes on Ubuntu

Dear Developer Team,

I am facing persistent issues with Firefox crashing on my Ubuntu PC, and the problem has been ongoing for the past 40‚Äì50 days. Despite multiple attempts at troubleshooting‚Äîincluding uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox, clearing all caches, and other measures‚Äîthe issue remains unresolved.

I‚Äôve noticed that Firefox works for a few days after reinstallation, but then problems begin to surface, such as a half-screen display. Eventually, after restarting the PC, the browser starts crashing again.

Could you please investigate this matter urgently and provide a resolution? Additionally, I would appreciate it if you could clarify whether this might be related to a RAM issue or some other underlying cause.

Looking forward to your assistance.

Best regards, zimmi

title: Mozilla Extended Support Browser
content:
Like probably a Lot of you I don't support the unethical So-called "Forced-obsolescence" and am not planning to "upgrade" Microsoft every 18 months or so for the next 90 years on each on Every single family Computer and give in to their Scare tactics for financial, environmental and Ethical reasons.

I am currently running Firefox "Extended Support," or ESR, I think it's called. Was wondering, If I ever **DO** decide to upgrade our bloatware Spyware operating system(s), basically if they break enough Apps like Apple Likes to do to force an upgrade, how difficult or easy would it be to Migrate from ESR to the latest regular version of Mozilla/Firefox...with all my Settings, etc. still in place?

title: Inserting a picture into the text of a picture
content:
raymond_j_markiewicz@hotmail.com raymond_j_markiewicz Question owner Today at 9:21‚ÄØPM

Dear Jim,

I needed to go to sleep at 3am last night to rise for a 12 noon Christmas day dinner. So I am back now.

I have not been able to drag a picture into the text of an email message.

I mark the point of insert with the cursor, go to Insert menu, select the attach picture, and it ends up at the top of the email outside my message. When I try to drag the picture into the text area, a mat covers the text area instructing to insert it here. When I release it on the hotspot, the matted area goes blank and I receive a menu message "The following files couldn't be attached: "filename.jpg". Please try again later."

I seem to be doing everything correctly. I was able to do this some time in the past.

I am wondering if the problem has to do with a memory cache problem. Do I have too many 2000 blocked emails. Maybe a security problem not allowing the attachment?

Ray (:-)
creator: raymond_j_markiewicz

title: Username saved when none should be saved.
content:
I do not store my usernames and passwords in firefox, I use a password manager. I also disable Remember Passwords and "Remember search and form history" For some reason before I unlock my password manager my "user name" from Site A is inputted into Site B's login field...

How?

It should have never been saved by anything in the browser yet it exist somewhere.

I made two alterations in about:config

browser.formfill.enable false browser.formfill.expire_days 1

This stopped it from inserting the username and I'm hoping this will remove the username from wherever it's saved but I want to know what file it was that contains form information?

title: Firefox nightly new menu bar
content: I really do not like the new menu / toolbar in firefox nightly. I guess I hadn't really noticed the changes until now. But it takes up half the page of my browser. Who thought this was a good idea? - to put it smack dab in the middle of the page?! Not me, that is for sure! Ok. So can we see a normal toolbar/ menu bar/ and optional toolbar at the top of the page, please? I like things the way they were. With various options to add buttons and pages or things that we need?? My toolbars were stacked appropriately in roles, with everything I needed on them. And they were always in the same place. Not moving around like toys on the floor.
